title: Social Welfare Act 2016 (No. 15 of 2016)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 7) (Treatment Benefit) 
Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2021 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2021. 

Commencement

title: Social Welfare Act 2016 (No. 15 of 2016)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation
heading: 2. These Regulations shall have effect from 27 March 2021.
text_raw:
2. These Regulations shall have effect from 27 March 2021. 

Amount payable in respect of medical appliance benefit
text_norm: 2 regulation shall effect 27 march 2021 amount payable respect medical appliance benefit

title: Social Welfare Act 2016 (No. 15 of 2016)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation
heading: 3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control)
text_raw:
3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) 
Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 142 of 2007) is amended by the substitution of the 
following article for article 110: 

“110. The payment to be made by the Minister in respect of 
medical appliance benefit under this article and article 111 shall 
be the cost of providing or repairing an appliance, subject to a 
maximum payment as may from time to time be fixed by the 
Minister, and the remainder of the said cost, if any, shall be paid 
by the claimant.”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 26th February, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [77] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

23 February, 2021. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [77]

title: Social Welfare Act 2016 (No. 15 of 2016)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations remove the requirement for the customer to pay 50% of the 
cost of medical appliance benefit, effective from 27 March 2021, arising from 
Budget 2021. 

At the time of signature the maximum hearing aid grant is €500 per hearing aid 
and the maximum repair grant is €100. If the cost exceeds the maximum grant 
the remainder shall be paid by the customer. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [77] 5
